description.short: Misura la vulnerabilit√† agli errori sistematici quando i sistemi di cybersecurity sopraffanno la capacit√† cognitiva umana attraverso complessit√† eccessiva
description.context: Quando le procedure di sicurezza richiedono l'elaborazione di pi√π di 7¬±2 chunk informativi simultaneamente, gli utenti ricorrono a scorciatoie semplificate che creano vulnerabilit√† prevedibili. Sistemi di autenticazione complessi, dashboard overwhelming e procedure di sicurezza bizantine guidano workaround che gli attaccanti sfruttano sistematicamente.
description.impact: Le organizzazioni con alta complessit√† sperimentano bypass sistematici delle procedure, abbandono degli strumenti di sicurezza, misconfigurazioni e aumento dei tassi di errore in condizioni normali. I sistemi complessi creano sovraccarico cognitivo che porta alla propagazione di ransomware attraverso workaround, bypass dei controlli durante periodi ad alto volume e fallimenti sistematici della sicurezza.
description.psychological_basis: Il principio del "numero magico sette" di Miller (1956) dimostra che la memoria di lavoro pu√≤ elaborare solo 7¬±2 chunk informativi simultaneamente. La Teoria del Carico Cognitivo di Sweller mostra che quando la complessit√† supera la capacit√†, l'elaborazione del Sistema 1 prende il sopravvento, portando a errori basati su euristiche. Neurologicamente, il sovraccarico della corteccia prefrontale compromette l'accuratezza del rilevamento delle minacce fino al 40%.

complexity_index.description: Cognitive Complexity Index combining cyclomatic complexity, nesting depth, and interface interactions

detection_threshold.formula: R_5.9(t) = 1 if CCI(t) > CCI_threshold AND P_error > 0.1, else 0

CCI.calculation: Cyclomatic complexity from procedure documentazione analysis
CCI.query: SELECT (decision_points - process_steps + 2*components) as cyclomatic_complexity FROM procedures WHERE procedure_type='security'

error_rate.calculation: Security task execution errors per procedure
error_rate.query: SELECT (COUNT(error='true') / COUNT(*)) as error_rate FROM task_execution WHERE task_category='security' AND time_window='24h'

workaround_frequency.query: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM audit_findings WHERE finding_type='procedure_deviation' AND time_window='30d'

decision_delay.calculation: Time spent on complex security decisions exceeding 30 seconds
decision_delay.query: SELECT AVG(decision_time) FROM user_analytics WHERE decision_time > 30 AND task_type='security' AND time_window='1h'

sections.title: QUICK ASSESSMENT

items.title: Incident Response Procedure Complexity
items.question: Quanti passi richiede la vostra procedura primaria di risposta agli incidenti di sicurezza dal rilevamento alla risoluzione?

options.label: ‚â§10 steps with ‚â§5 major decision points
10-15 steps with 6-10 decision points
>15 steps with >10 decision points or regularly abandoned under pressure

items.evidence_required: Incident response playbook documentazione with step count and decision tree mapping

items.title: Team Overwhelm Reports
items.question: Quanto spesso i vostri team di sicurezza hanno riferito di essere sopraffatti da allarmi, dashboard o complessit√† degli strumenti di sicurezza negli ultimi 3 mesi?

options.label: Raramente - Less than monthly reports of overwhelm
Occasionally - Monthly overwhelm reports or complexity complaints
Frequently - Weekly or daily overwhelm reports, high cognitive burden feedback

items.evidence_required: Help desk tickets mentioning complexity, team feedback surveys, retrospective meeting notes
items.soc_mapping: Help desk ticket volume with 'complexity' or 'overwhelmed' keywords

items.title: Emergency Procedure Simplification
items.question: Cosa happens when il vostro security procedures are too time-consuming or complex during urgent situations?

options.label: Procedures maintained with emergency simplified versions pre-approved
Procedures occasionally modified or steps skipped under pressure
Procedures frequently abandoned, modified on-the-fly, or skipped entirely during emergencies

items.evidence_required: Incident revisiones che mostra procedure adherence, emergency bypass documentazione
items.soc_mapping: Incident response log tracking steps_completed vs steps_required

items.title: SOC Analyst System Monitoring Load
items.question: Quanti diversi sistemi di sicurezza devono monitorare simultaneamente i vostri analisti SOC durante un turno tipico?

options.label: ‚â§7 systems with unified dashboard presenting key metrics
7-9 systems requiring separate monitoring
>9 systems requiring constant context switching between interfaces

items.evidence_required: SOC workstation observation, tool inventory, analyst workflow documentazione
items.soc_mapping: Count of active security tool logins per analyst shift

items.title: Unofficial Simplification Procedures
items.question: Cosa unofficial shortcuts or workarounds have il vostro security teams created to simplify complex procedures?

options.label: No unofficial workarounds, formal simplification process exists
Alcuni workarounds exist but are documentati and revisioneed for security impact
Widespread undocumented workarounds, informal simplifications, shadow procedures

items.evidence_required: Audit findings of procedure deviations, interviews revealing actual practices vs documented procedures

items.title: Complexity Assessment Process
items.question: Come misurate se le vostre procedure di sicurezza sono troppo complesse per un'esecuzione coerente?

options.label: Formal complexity assessment using decision point counting, error rate tracking, and user feedback metrics
Informal assessment through feedback collection but no systematic measurement
No complexity assessment process exists

items.evidence_required: Complexity assessment methodology documentazione, measurement results, decision point analysis
items.soc_mapping: Complexity scoring in procedure documentazione metadata

items.title: Complexity Concern Response Process
items.question: Cosa is il vostro processo when security team members report that procedures are too complex to follow reliably?

options.label: Established escalation path, complexity concerns tracked and addressed, simplification revisiones conducted
Informal response, concerns noted but inconsistent action
No formal process, concerns dismissed, or expectation that staff should master complexity

items.evidence_required: Complexity concern ticketing system, resolution tracking, simplification initiative documentazione
items.soc_mapping: Tickets with category='complexity_concern' and resolution status

items.title: Security Dashboard Information Density
items.question: Quante categorie di informazioni o metriche distinte sono presentate simultaneamente sulla vostra dashboard di sicurezza primaria?

options.label: ‚â§7 key metrics with progressive disclosure for details
8-12 metrics visible simultaneously
>12 metrics requiring simultaneous attention

items.title: Authentication Process Complexity
items.question: Quanti passi sono richiesti per il vostro processo di autenticazione pi√π comune (login tipico dell'utente ai sistemi primari)?

options.label: ‚â§3 steps with risk-based adaptive authentication
4-6 steps for routine authentication
>6 steps or multiple system interactions required for routine access

items.evidence_required: Authentication workflow documentazione, step-by-step process mapping

items.title: Regular Simplification Review Process
items.question: Con quale frequenza conducete revisioni formali per semplificare e razionalizzare le procedure di sicurezza?

options.label: Quarterly or more frequent simplification revisiones with documentati improvements
Annual revisiones or when problems are reported
No regular simplification revisiones conducted

items.evidence_required: Simplification revisione meeting minutes, procedure optimization project documentazione
items.soc_mapping: Change management log che mostra procedure simplification initiatives

sections.instructions: Selezionare UNA opzione per ciascuna domanda. Ogni risposta contribuisce al punteggio finale ponderato. Le evidenze dovrebbero essere documentate per la traccia di audit.

items.text: Mi descriva il vostro primary security incident response procedure from start to finish. How many distinct steps and decision points fa it contain?

scoring_guidance.green: Clear procedure with ‚â§10 steps and ‚â§5 decision points, team confident in execution, recent successful esempio provided
scoring_guidance.yellow: Procedure with 10-15 steps, some decision confusion, mixed confidence in execution
scoring_guidance.red: Complex procedure >15 steps, multiple decision trees, team reports confusion or regular skipping under pressure

followups.text: During il vostro last real incident, did the team follow this procedure exactly as fatecumented, or were steps modified or skipped?
Quanto tempo fa it take to train new analysts to execute this procedure confidently?

items.text: Descriva a recent situation where il vostro team di sicurezza reported being overwhelmed by complexity. What specifically was overwhelming?

scoring_guidance.green: Rare overwhelm situations, specific mitigations in place, complexity monitoring exists
scoring_guidance.yellow: Occasional overwhelm reports, reactive responses, no systematic measurement
scoring_guidance.red: Frequent overwhelm reports, chronic cognitive burden, no mitigation strategy

followups.text: Cosa changes did voi make after that situation to reduce complexity?
Come fate voi currently measure cognitive load or complexity burden on il vostro team di sicurezza?

items.text: Cosa happens during urgent security situations when standard procedures are too complex or time-consuming? Give me a specific esempio recente.

scoring_guidance.green: Pre-approved simplified emergency procedures exist, adherence maintained, documented esempios
scoring_guidance.yellow: Some on-the-fly modifications, informal simplifications, inconsistent documentazione
scoring_guidance.red: Regular procedure abandonment, ad-hoc decision making, systematic bypasses under pressure

followups.text: Have voi ever revisioneed incidents to see if complexity-driven bypasses contributed to security failures?

items.text: Take me through a typical SOC analyst's workstation. How many different security systems fate they monitor simultaneously, and how complex is the information they must elaborano?

scoring_guidance.green: ‚â§7 integrated systems, unified dashboards with progressive disclosure, clear information hierarchy
scoring_guidance.yellow: 7-9 systems, some integration but frequent context switching required
scoring_guidance.red: >9 separate systems, overwhelming information density, constant context switching

followups.text: Quanto tempo fa it take an analyst to become proficient with all these systems?
Have voi ever measured how much time analysts spend just navigating between tools versus actual security analysis?

items.text: Cosa unofficial shortcuts or workarounds have il vostro team di sicurezzas developed to deal with complex systems or procedures?

scoring_guidance.green: No significant workarounds, formal simplification process captures improvement needs
scoring_guidance.yellow: Some documented workarounds with security revisione, informal knowledge sharing
scoring_guidance.red: Widespread undocumented workarounds, shadow procedures, systematic unofficial simplifications

followups.text: Come did voi discover these workarounds? fate voi think voi know about all of them?
Have any of these workarounds created security vulnerabilities or compliance issues?

items.text: Come fate voi systematically assess whether il vostro security procedures are too complex for reliable human execution?

scoring_guidance.green: Formal complexity assessment using decision point counting, error rate correlation, cognitive load metrics, regular revisiones
scoring_guidance.yellow: Informal assessment through feedback and observation, reactive measurement when problems occur
scoring_guidance.red: No systematic assessment, complexity not considered in procedure design, expectation that staff adapt to complexity

followups.text: Show me il vostro most recent complexity assessment report or analysis. What did voi learn and what changed?
Qual √® il vostro target maximum for decision points or steps in a security procedure?

items.text: Quanfate team di sicurezza members report that procedures are too complex to follow reliably, what's il vostro response elaborano? Give me a esempio recente.

scoring_guidance.green: Formal escalation path exists, complexity concerns tracked as priority issues, simplification initiatives launched, esempios of successful simplification
scoring_guidance.yellow: Informal response, concerns discussed but slow action, training emphasized over simplification
scoring_guidance.red: No formal process, concerns dismissed as training issues, expectation that staff master complexity

followups.text: Quanti complexity-related concerns have been raised in the past 6 months, and how many resulted in actual procedure simplification?

items.text: Con quale frequenza fate voi conduct formal revisiones specifically aimed at simplifying and streamlining security procedures?

scoring_guidance.green: Quarterly or more frequent revisiones, documented simplification initiatives, measurable reduction in complexity metrics
scoring_guidance.yellow: Annual revisiones or reactive revisiones when problems surface, inconsistent follow-through

continuous_validation.complexity_tracking: Monitor procedure complexity metrics (decision points, steps, interface counts) monthly
continuous_validation.correlation_analysis: Correlate complexity measures with error rates, help desk tickets, and audit findings (target correlation > 0.70)
continuous_validation.drift_detection: Track complexity creep over time, alert if procedures gain >20% decision points without revisione

calibration.description: Ensure predicted error rates based on complexity match observed execution errors
calibration.recalibration_trigger: Error prediction accuracy < 75% or significant procedure changes

success_metrics.measurement: automated logging from alert to first response action

solutions.title: Progressive Alert Reduction
solutions.description: Implement tiered alert systems presenting only 3-5 high-priority alerts per shift with additional details available on demand
solutions.implementation: Deploy SIEM rule tuning to reduce false positives by 60%, create escalation paths activating only when initial tiers resolved, implement progressive disclosure UI patterns
solutions.technical_controls: SIEM alert correlation rules, priority scoring algorithms, tiered dashboard interfaces, alert suppression logic

solutions.title: Simplified Incident Response Cards
solutions.description: Create single-page response cards for top 5 incident types, each containing ‚â§7 action steps with clear decision trees
solutions.implementation: Analyze incident patterns to identify top scenarios, design simplified response cards with QR codes linking to detailed procedures, enable immediate response while maintaining access to depth when needed
solutions.technical_controls: Quick reference card templates, QR code integration, mobile-accessible detailed procedures, decision tree visualization

solutions.title: Cognitive Load Monitoring
solutions.description: Deploy user experience analytics on security tools to identify interfaces causing >30-second decision delays or high error rates
solutions.implementation: Implement automated complexity scoring for security procedures using decision point counting and information density analysis, establish complexity budgets for new procedures
solutions.technical_controls: UX analytics platform integration, decision delay tracking, error rate correlation analysis, complexity scoring algorithms

solutions.title: Authentication Streamlining
solutions.description: Replace complex multi-step authentication with risk-based adaptive authentication reducing steps for low-risk scenarios
solutions.implementation: Implement single sign-on with behavioral analytics, maintain security while eliminating routine authentication complexity, add contextual MFA triggers for anomalous scenarios
solutions.technical_controls: Risk-based authentication engine, behavioral analytics, SSO platform, adaptive MFA system

solutions.title: Security Tool Consolidation
solutions.description: Audit security tool stack and consolidate overlapping functions into unified dashboards che mostra ‚â§7 key metrics simultaneously
solutions.implementation: Conduct tool inventory, identify functional overlap, implement integration layer for unified monitoring, automate routine tasks requiring complex system interactions
solutions.technical_controls: SOAR platform for orchestration, unified dashboard development, API integrations, workflow automation

solutions.title: Team Complexity Training
solutions.description: Provide specific training on recognizing cognitive overload symptoms and approved simplification procedures
solutions.implementation: Create formal escalation paths for complexity concerns, establish 'complexity budgets' limiting simultaneous complex tasks per team member, train on cognitive load management techniques
solutions.technical_controls: Training platform with cognitive load modules, complexity concern ticketing system, workload balancing dashboards

risk_scenarios.title: Dashboard Overwhelm Exploitation
risk_scenarios.description: Attackers time malicious activities during high-alert periods when SOC analysts are managing 10+ simultaneous security events. The cognitive overload causes analysts to miss critical threat indicators or dismiss legitimate alerts as false positives, enabling persistence and lateral movement.
risk_scenarios.attack_vector: Deliberate alert flooding combined with stealthy attack during cognitive saturation
risk_scenarios.psychological_mechanism: Working memory overflow and attention tunneling under high information load
risk_scenarios.historical_esempio: Multiple ransomware campaigns timed attacks during high-volume periods when SOC teams dismissed alerts

risk_scenarios.title: Authentication Complexity Bypass
risk_scenarios.description: Complex multi-factor authentication procedures requiring 6+ steps with multiple systems drive users to create unauthorized simplifications like shared accounts, password reuse, or storing credentials insecurely. Attackers exploit these predictable shortcuts to gain initial access and privilege escalation.
risk_scenarios.attack_vector: Social engineering targeting users known to use complexity workarounds
risk_scenarios.psychological_mechanism: Cognitive rebellion against overwhelming security friction
risk_scenarios.historical_esempio: Healthcare sector breaches where complex EMR security protocols led to credential sharing

risk_scenarios.title: Incident Response Breakdown
risk_scenarios.description: Complex incident response playbooks with 20+ decision points and 5+ system interactions cause teams to skip critical containment steps during actual incidents. Attackers exploit this predictable degradation in response quality to extend dwell time and maximize damage during breaches.
risk_scenarios.attack_vector: Advanced persistent threats that trigger complex response procedures knowing they'll degrade under pressure
risk_scenarios.psychological_mechanism: Decision fatigue and procedure abandonment under time pressure combined with complexity
risk_scenarios.historical_esempio: Financial services breaches where complex response procedures were abandoned during active incidents

risk_scenarios.title: Administrative Privilege Errors
risk_scenarios.description: Complex identity management systems with Byzantine permission structures cause administrators to grant excessive privileges to avoid repeated complexity. Attackers exploit these over-privileged accounts for rapid lateral movement and data exfiltration.
risk_scenarios.attack_vector: Targeting accounts with excessive privileges granted due to complexity avoidance
risk_scenarios.psychological_mechanism: Complexity-induced simplification leading to systematic over-privileging
risk_scenarios.historical_esempio: Cloud platform breaches where complex IAM structures led to overly permissive role assignments
